label.intro:
Graphs of basic summaries, such as bar charts, can be achieved using both spreadsheet software and statistics packages. However, leveraging graphics for data visualisation becomes more powerful when using a statistics package.


Graphics from a statistical package are more powerful, partially due to the multidimensional capabilities that are offered in a statistical package. By adding layers to a graph, analysts can build up this dimensionality - investigating the influence of multiple variables in tandem, and independently, on the outcome.


The concept of layers stems from the grammar of graphics (Wilkinson, 2012). Statistical packages offer a range of powerful visualisations that go beyond basic plots, enabling the analyst to dig deeper into the data and the variability within it.


Wilkinson, L., 2012. The grammar of graphics (pp. 375-414). Springer Berlin Heidelberg.
